clinical_study.brief_title: Early Versus Late Hydration After Cesarean Section (CS)
clinical_study.official_title: Early Versus Late Oral Hydration After Cesarean Section: A Randomized Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the effect of early oral hydration on bowel movement after CS, it includes 2 groups: study group participants receive 100 ml water after 1hr from the end of CS, while the others receive water after 6hrs from the end of CS.

detailed_description.textblock:
Traditionally, oral intake after CS was depend on insurance of intestinal movement, since uncomplicated CS does not affect the intestine and the mother needs to care of her infants, lactates, discharged from hospital, early oral hydration may enhance bowel movement, so the investigators need to evaluate the safety of early oral hydration after CS.
This study compare the effects of introducing water during the 1st hour or after 6 hours on bowel movement after CS.

primary_outcome.description: Auscultating intestinal sounds (using stethoscope) hourly for the first 12 hours after Cesarean Section till intestinal sounds are audible.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to passage of first flatus
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours following the Cesarean Section
secondary_outcome.description: Recording the timing of passage of first flatus following Cesarean Section (up to the first 48 hours).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days (72 hours) following Cesarean Section
secondary_outcome.description: Recording the first time the pass stools after cesarean section (up to the first 72 hours).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 24 hours after the Cesarean Section
secondary_outcome.description: Recording the first time to breastfeed after cesarean section (up to the first 24 hours).

arm_group.description: Early oral intake of 100 ml clear unsweetened water 1 hour following the Cesarean Section, then upon patient's desire, then starting semisolid, solid food when participant passed flatus.
Oral intake of 100 ml clear unsweetened water after 6 hours from the end of CS then upon patient's request,then starting semisolid, solid food when participant passed flatus.

intervention.description: starting oral hydration 1 hour following Cesarean Section using 100 ml clear water
starting oral hydration 6 hours following Cesarean Section using 100 ml clear water

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- uncomplicated elective or emergency lower segment Caesarean section
- average blood loss during and after cs
- regional anaesthesia
- primary or recurrent CS
Exclusion Criteria:
- surgical complications esp; intestinal injury
- postpartum hemorrhage
- medical disorder with pregnancy eg. hypertension, diabetes mellitus
- factors that may increase risk of postpartum hemorrhage as twins pregnancy, polyhydramnios and anemia
